item.title: Bulletin updated at 12:02 HKT 10/06/2023
item.description:
At noon at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 29 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 82 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 5
Intensity of UV radiation : moderate

The area of low pressure now over the vicinity of Beibu Wan will linger over the vicinity of Leizhou Peninsula tomorrow (11 June). It is expected to move across the coast of western Guangdong and its coastal waters next Monday and Tuesday, and may edge closer to the vicinity of the Pearl River Estuary. There would be heavy showers and squally thunderstorms over that area by then. The Observatory will closely monitor whether the area of low pressure will develop into a tropical cyclone and its impact to Hong Kong. Members of the public please pay attention to the latest weather information.

Hot weather might cause adverse health effects. The public should stay on the alert and drink more water.
